data.text:
HOLLYWOOD INSTITUTION

WARNER BROS

BRIEF INTRODUCTION TO WARNER BROS

Warner Bros is an american based entertainment industry which is both vertically and horizontally integrated .In Hollywood it is one of the major-role playing film industry. And is considered in Hollywood’s Big Six’ as most famous and important since it also creates , produces ,distributes ,license and markets all of its products in all forms of entertainment and related businesses.Warner Bros played an important role during the ‘Great Depression’ era -the world war period. Warner Bros is a Time Warner subsidiary founded by four brothers -Harry,Albert , Sam and Jack in 1923 and since then is a successful world class quality entertainment and technological foresight diversified entertainment company . Warner Bros is now the most prestigious and prodigious in the world with the ownership to major blockbuster films like Harry Potter ,Troy ,etc .

BRIEF INFORMATION ABOUT WARNER BROTHERS –

PRODUCTION AND DISTRIBUTIONS

Warner Bros. produces and distributes its films with a business paradigm that mitigates risk while maximizing productivity and capital. Warner Bros produces, distributes and markets its films and holds its worldwide distribution rights as it either fully finances or co-finances these films. Warner Bros. is a global leader in the marketing and distribution of feature films, operating offices in more than 30 countries and releases films in over 120 international territories either directly to theaters or in collaboration with partner companies or co-ventures. Warner Bros New Line Cinema coordinates its development, production, marketing, distribution and business affairs activities to maximize film performance and operation efficiency’s. Alongside Warner Bros Pictures is WBTVG which is developing new business models – landscape including ad-supported video on demand, broadband and wireless and has digital distribution agreements in place with all of the broadcast networks. Warner Bros Studio is world’s biggest distributor of films, television programs and animation to the worldwide market place. WBTVG also provides original short form programming for broadband and wireless marketplace through its Studio 2.0 digital venture. It also strategically expands into digital production along with broadcasting with quality, diverse programming which is mainly targeted the premium youth aged around 18-34.

PROLIFERATION

Proliferation in terms of media is known to be the sudden exponential growth in the media technology used by the media persons and media related companies. It is the increase in amount of hardware and content available to both audience and institution through emergence of new and old media, for example, the use of IMAX technology during the productions of new films.

PROLIFERATION IN WARNER BROS

Warner Brothers was among the first in the content industry to grasp the full disruptive power, potential and implications of digital technologies. One of the major film studios, it is a subsidiary of Time Warner. Warner Bros. has several subsidiary companies which makes it one of the big six in Hollywood with the greatest influence and popularity around the world. In terms of proliferation in this industry the use of new technology especially in hardware can be seen as more cameras of high definition along with 3-D capture are being used nowadays. With the introduction of new technology new application for editing, Photoshop’s are used to make the video have more realistic effects and quality. New machines to make sound quality better are also used for better sounds .In terms of content better methods of distributing and marketing the film are used for targeting a wider range of audiences.

Warner Bros. Studio facilitates international and national operations one of which is the production and post-production of the motion pictures. It also facilitates physical sets on land, jungles or main street houses and provides sound stages and various exterior sets. Warner Bros studios are a leader in sound design, mixing and editorial services as DVD audio mastering. The studio operates most technological advance equipment in the industry for its post – Production. For the production 16 re-recording stages along with the state of the art scoring stage, five automated dialogue replacement stages, two Foley stages and over 175 editing rooms that handle digital and analogue audio editing, full service mastering and a wide range of digital services including restoration compression and distribution. The Studio is basically a complete process of production related services along with mise-en-scene and all production stages such as costumes, set dressing, design and construction scenic art lighting effects etc. Studio also is responsible for managing the company’s studio in the U.K.

WARNER BROS. DIGITAL DISTRIBUTION, founded in 2005 is a part of the Warner Bros. Home Entertainment Group, oversees the electronic distribution of Warner Bros. Home Entertainment Group’s content through Video-On-Demand, Pay-Per-View, Electronic Sell-Through and Subscription Video-On-Demand via cable, satellite, online and mobile channels. WBDD also distributes content through third party digital retailers and licensees. A worldwide industry leader since its inception, WBDD manages the Studio’s e-commerce sites that include WBShop.com and WarnerArchive.com

WBDD is further charged with managing the Studio’s retail and consumer transition of product produced by Warner Home Video and Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment from a purely packaged distribution scheme to one that supports both packaged and digital distribution, as well as both standard and high definition formats.

WARNER BROS. HOME ENTERTAINMENT (WBHE) is charged with harnessing the benefits of emerging technologies as well as managing the risks with them which are posed to the economic value of the content. WBHE also focuses on the future distribution scenarios to make the content available to audiences through channels platforms and devices as possible. By grouping like business units and processing the Studio’s content in the format of the customer’s preference as conveniently as possible WBHE helps the Studio to be the leading and defining role in the rapidly evolving marketplace with new era experiences.

Warner Bros Consumer Products licenses the rights for all the intellectual products properties in the vast film and television library. As Warner Bros has a global network of offices it helps in expanding and building the power of its brands recognition in the international market through strong merchandise, promotional marketing and retail programs.

DC Entertainments DC Comics have been published for more than 60 years and are the leading comic book publisher in the industry and creator of some of the world’s most famous icons such as batman. DC’s characters capture the spotlight to blockbuster films, live-action and animated television series with direct to video releases, collectors books online entertainment, digital publishing and mostly graphic novels.

Warner Brothers: Film Exhibition

Exhibition is the retail branch of film industry. Exhibitors, to a certain extent, control how the film is presented and hence, have a major over the box office success. Thus, the exhibition of a film is considerably important.

History

The Jazz Singer and The Singing Fool (1927-28) gave a big boost Warner Brothers. Due to the profits from successful films, Warner Brothers acquired the Stanley Theater Chain in September 1928.

Stanley Theater Chain

Stanley Theaters have undergone ownership changes but regardless, have always remained affiliated with Warner Bros. Pictures. Stanley Theaters were bought by Warner Bros. as the company was eager to showcase its movies on as many screens as possible. The Stanley Theater (Utica, New York) was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1976.

Warner Village Cinemas

It was a chain of multiplex cinemas operated in the UK. It was a joint venture by Warner Bros. and Village Roadshow Australia. It was created in 1996. They started expansion in 1997 with 40 sites open. However, it was purchased by SBC International Cinemas and were renamed Vue Cinemas.

Other Developments

Along with Toshiba, Warner Bros was involved in the development of DVDs and DVD players. Some 277 million DVD players have been sold in the US alone. Among its many screening facilities, Warner Bros. Studios houses the Steven J. Ross Theater. Warner Bros. Home Video is responsible for DVD and Blu-Ray sales. It had a 21% market share in total DVD and Blu-Ray sales in 2011. It is also responsible for worldwide broadcasting.

Warner Bros Pictures Group has been at the forefront of the motion picture industry since its inception and continues to be a leading creative force in the industry. Warner Bros. Pictures produces and distributes a wide-ranging slate of some 18-22 films each year, employing a business paradigm that mitigates risk while maximizing productivity and capital. Warner Bros. Pictures either fully finances or co-finances the films it produces and maintains worldwide distribution rights. It also monetizes its distribution and marketing operations by distributing films that are totally financed and produced by others. Current multi-faceted co-financing joint ventures include those with Village Roadshow Pictures, Castle Rock Entertainment and Legendary Pictures. Warner Bros. Pictures also has a distribution, co-financing deal with Alcon Entertainment. New Line Cinema is a part of warner bros pictures group, Building on more than four decades of innovation and creativity, New Line Cinema continues its long and successful history of producing critically acclaimed hit films that resonate with both mainstream and niche audiences around the world. The Pictures group also include the Warner Brothers Pictures International; WARNER BROS. PICTURES INTERNATIONAL is a global leader in the marketing and distribution of feature films, operating offices in more than 30 countries and releasing films in over 120 international territories, either directly to theaters or in conjunction with partner companies and co-ventures. WBPI meets worldwide tastes and demands with a diverse mix of filmed entertainment produced primarily by Warner Bros. Pictures but also generated or co-financed by such entities as Castle Rock Entertainment, Village Roadshow Pictures, Alcon Entertainment and Legendary Pictures, among others. It has pioneered a number of initiatives and strategies that anticipate tremendous growth and change within the global entertainment marketplace.

In 2012, the Warner Bros. Pictures Group grossed $4.3 billion at the worldwide box office ($1.66 billion domestic, $2.67 international) with both its domestic and international divisions crossing the billion-dollar mark for a 12th consecutive year, a feat unmatched by any other studio. The Pictures Group has exceeded $4 billion globally for four consecutive years, also a milestone no other studio has ever achieved.

Example of the movies produced by Warner brothers:

I have chosen Warner Bros as my chosen institute for my Advanced Portfolio as Warner Bros as a whole continues to be a leader in trendsetting across all platforms and outlets and in the digital realm with video on demand, brand channels, original content, apps, anti-piracy technology and broadband and wireless destinations. The institute excels in producing action movies and as my chosen genre is also action I’m inspired by these movies such as Expendables series, The Lethal Weapon series and the specialist etc. thus it has pushed me to choose this institute.
